intro: Hieracium efulcrum, commonly known as the bent-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive wavy or curled edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Hieracium efulcrum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
